questions.questionText: What must a licensee disclose to another licensee in a transaction involving a one-to-four-family residential property?
options: A) The licensee’s commission rate
B) The agency relationship with the buyer
C) The seller’s confidential information
D) The listing price
questions.explanation: A buyer’s licensee must disclose the agency relationship with the buyer.

questions.questionText: When must a buyer’s licensee disclose their agency relationship in a residential transaction?
options: A) Only during the showing
B) At the earliest of first contact, showing, or negotiation
C) After an offer is accepted
D) When the seller requests it
questions.explanation: Disclosure must be made early to ensure clarity of roles.

questions.questionText: What document is used for a Wisconsin listing firm cooperating with an out-of-state licensee (OSL)?
options: A) WB-36
B) WB-28
C) WB-11
D) WB-45
questions.explanation: WB-28 is the cooperative agreement for a Wisconsin listing firm and an OSL.

questions.questionText: What is required of an out-of-state licensee cooperating in Wisconsin?
options: A) Hold earnest money
B) Comply with Wisconsin law
C) Negotiate directly with buyers
D) List properties in Wisconsin
questions.explanation: OSLs must comply with Wisconsin law and cannot hold client funds or list properties.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee do if the buyer’s agency status changes?
options: A) Notify the seller or listing licensee
B) Do nothing
C) Cancel the transaction
D) Request approval from the seller
questions.explanation: The licensee must notify relevant parties when the agency status changes.

questions.questionText: What is a material adverse fact?
options: A) A minor issue with a property
B) Information that would influence a party’s decision in the transaction
C) A positive feature of the property
D) Personal opinions about the property
questions.explanation: Material adverse facts are significant issues that influence transaction decisions.

questions.questionText: When must a licensee disclose a right of first refusal?
options: A) After an offer is accepted
B) At closing
C) In writing, in a timely manner
D) Only if requested by the buyer
questions.explanation: Disclosure must be timely and in writing to all parties seeking an interest.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the WB-36 Buyer Agency Agreement?
options: A) To list a property for sale
B) To establish an agency relationship between a buyer and a firm
C) To transfer ownership of a property
D) To disclose material facts
questions.explanation: The WB-36 creates an agency relationship between a buyer and a firm.

questions.questionText: What is prohibited under Wis. Admin. Code § REEB 24.07(7)?
options: A) Exaggerating the value of a property
B) Giving false information about another licensee or property
C) Holding earnest money without consent
D) Disclosing agency relationships
questions.explanation: Licensees must not knowingly provide false information about others or properties.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee do when a material adverse fact is discovered?
options: A) Ignore it
B) Disclose it to all parties in writing
C) Wait for the client’s permission
D) Remove it from the contract
questions.explanation: Material adverse facts must be disclosed in writing and in a timely manner.

questions.questionText: What does a listing firm provide when a WB listing contract expires?
options: A) Protected buyer list
B) A refund of commission
C) A new listing contract
D) Seller’s disclosure forms
questions.explanation: Protected buyers are listed to extend the listing agreement for those buyers.

questions.questionText: Can a licensee submit a personal offer on a property listed by their firm if they know the terms of a pending offer?
options: A) Yes, at any time
B) Only if the pending offer is rejected
C) No, this is prohibited
D) Only with seller approval
questions.explanation: A licensee cannot submit a personal offer if they know the terms of a pending offer.

questions.questionText: What must be done when a written proposal is rejected?
options: A) Notify the other party verbally
B) Notify the other party in writing with the date and time
C) Destroy the proposal
D) Notify the other party only if they request it
questions.explanation: The licensee must document the rejection in writing, including date and time.

questions.questionText: What is steering in real estate?
options: A) Advising clients on financing options
B) Showing properties only in certain areas based on a protected class
C) Encouraging buyers to submit multiple offers
D) Conducting property inspections
questions.explanation: Steering is discriminatory and violates fair housing laws.

questions.questionText: Who can hold client funds in Wisconsin real estate transactions?
options: A) Out-of-state licensees
B) Wisconsin firms only
C) Any licensed individual
D) Attorneys only
questions.explanation: Only Wisconsin firms can hold client funds like earnest money.

questions.questionText: What does the term “protected buyer” mean?
options: A) A buyer with pre-approved financing
B) A buyer identified under an expired listing who extends the listing contract
C) A buyer who purchases multiple properties
D) A buyer who waives contingencies
questions.explanation: Protected buyers extend the listing contract after it expires for those specific buyers.

questions.questionText: What is the primary purpose of a relocation company in a transaction?
options: A) To negotiate directly with buyers
B) To assist with transfers related to employment moves
C) To replace the listing firm
D) To provide financial advice
questions.explanation: Relocation companies assist with employment-related moves.

questions.questionText: What is the primary requirement for a Wisconsin firm cooperating with an out-of-state licensee?
options: A) A verbal agreement
B) A written cooperative agreement
C) Approval from the REEB
D) Holding the license in escrow
questions.explanation: A written cooperative agreement is required for cooperation.

questions.questionText: What is the consequence of knowingly giving false information about another licensee?
options: A) The licensee may lose their license
B) The licensee is fined $5,000
C) The licensee is awarded a commission
D) The licensee is automatically suspended
questions.explanation: Providing false information can result in disciplinary action, including license revocation.

questions.questionText: What action is required if a licensee becomes aware of information suggesting a material adverse fact?
options: A) Investigate the fact independently
B) Disclose it in writing and recommend further investigation
C) Wait for the client’s confirmation
D) Ignore the information
questions.explanation: The licensee must disclose the information and recommend expert assistance if necessary.

questions.questionText: When must a licensee disclose a buyer agency relationship to a seller or listing licensee?
options: A) Only during negotiations
B) Only if requested by the seller
C) At the earliest of first contact, showing, or negotiation
D) After an offer is submitted
questions.explanation: Disclosure ensures clarity of roles early in the transaction.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of a WB-29 Commercial Cooperative Agreement?
options: A) To establish compensation for a Wisconsin listing firm
B) To cooperate with an out-of-state licensee on a commercial property
C) To provide buyer agency services
D) To transfer listing authority to another firm
questions.explanation: The WB-29 is used for commercial transactions between Wisconsin firms and out-of-state licensees.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee do if a seller has prohibited the disclosure of an accepted offer?
options: A) Disclose it only to other licensees
B) Follow the seller’s instructions
C) Announce it at open houses
D) Automatically disclose it to all buyers
questions.explanation: The licensee must follow the seller’s specific instructions regarding disclosure.

questions.questionText: Under what circumstances can a licensee negotiate directly with a represented party?
options: A) Only if the firm consents or the firm is unavailable
B) At any time
C) Only after the listing agreement ends
D) Only if the represented party requests it
questions.explanation: Direct negotiation is permitted with the firm’s consent or under specific conditions, such as unavailability.

questions.questionText: What is a material adverse fact?
options: A) Any fact that complicates the transaction
B) A fact that significantly affects a party’s decision to proceed
C) A minor issue that does not require disclosure
D) A seller’s confidential information
questions.explanation: Material adverse facts influence a party’s decision regarding the transaction.

questions.questionText: What does a relocation company typically require from a cooperating firm?
options: A) Exclusive right to list the property
B) A referral fee agreement
C) The use of only relocation company forms
D) A guarantee of buyer financing
questions.explanation: Relocation companies often expect referral fees as part of the transaction.

questions.questionText: What is prohibited under Wis. Admin. Code § REEB 24.13 regarding written proposals?
options: A) Rejecting a proposal without consultation
B) Withholding a proposal pending action on another
C) Drafting proposals with contingencies
D) Presenting proposals to unrepresented parties
questions.explanation: Licensees must promptly present all written proposals to the relevant parties.

questions.questionText: How can a licensee ensure compliance when assisting a buyer with a relocation company’s addendum?
options: A) Fill out the addendum independently
B) Act only as a courier for the addendum
C) Modify the addendum as needed
D) Refuse to include the addendum
questions.explanation: Licensees cannot modify or complete non-approved forms but can act as a courier.

questions.questionText: What should a licensee do if a buyer contacts them directly during an open house?
options: A) Ask the buyer if they are represented by another firm
B) Encourage the buyer to make an offer immediately
C) Proceed without verifying agency relationships
D) Refuse to work with the buyer
questions.explanation: Professional courtesy and regulatory compliance require verifying representation.

questions.questionText: What must a listing firm provide at the end of a WB listing contract to extend protections?
options: A) A list of protected buyers
B) A new commission agreement
C) A property condition report
D) A signed addendum
questions.explanation: Protected buyer provisions extend the listing for those buyers.

questions.questionText: What is required for a Wisconsin firm to cooperate with an out-of-state licensee (OSL)?
options: A) A signed WB-28 or WB-29 Cooperative Agreement
B) A verbal understanding between the firms
C) The OSL must hold escrow funds
D) An agreement to bypass Wisconsin law
questions.explanation: Cooperative agreements are mandatory for Wisconsin firms and OSLs to work together.

questions.questionText: What is an example of steering in real estate?
options: A) Showing properties in multiple neighborhoods
B) Showing properties based on a buyer’s membership in a protected class
C) Referring buyers to a specific lender
D) Offering properties within the buyer’s budget
questions.explanation: Steering involves limiting property options based on protected characteristics.

questions.questionText: What is the significance of a “bump clause” in an accepted offer?
options: A) It requires immediate acceptance of other offers
B) It allows a secondary offer to become primary under certain conditions
C) It invalidates the primary offer automatically
D) It eliminates the need for contingencies
questions.explanation: A bump clause enables a secondary offer to take precedence if certain contingencies are met.

questions.questionText: What is required of a licensee who learns of false information in a seller’s disclosure?
options: A) Report it to the authorities immediately
B) Disclose it in writing to all parties in the transaction
C) Ignore the information if the seller insists
D) Cancel the transaction
questions.explanation: Licensees must disclose material adverse facts or false information to protect all parties.

questions.questionText: What does the WB-36 Buyer Agency Agreement require a buyer to do regarding commission?
options: A) Pay a commission only if the firm procures the property
B) Pay a commission regardless of the firm’s involvement in the transaction
C) Only pay commission if requested by the seller
D) Waive commission if the buyer acts independently
questions.explanation: An unmodified WB-36 requires buyers to pay a firm’s commission even if the firm isn’t directly involved.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee do when presenting written proposals?
options: A) Inform the client only of the advantages of the proposal
B) Provide an unbiased and objective summary
C) Withhold unfavorable offers
D) Encourage rejection of low offers
questions.explanation: Proposals must be presented objectively, including both advantages and disadvantages.

questions.questionText: What happens if a relocation company verbally accepts an offer?
options: A) The offer is legally binding
B) The buyer must waive all contingencies
C) The offer is not binding until signed and delivered
D) The relocation company is required to sign immediately
questions.explanation: Wisconsin law requires offers to be in writing and delivered to be binding.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee include when disclosing their role as a principal in a transaction?
options: A) The intended purchase price
B) Their licensed status at the earliest contact
C) A waiver of agency duties
D) A new contract with the seller
questions.explanation: Licensed status and intent must be disclosed early to the other party.

questions.questionText: What is the consequence of failing to disclose a right of first refusal?
options: A) The transaction is invalid
B) Legal action against the licensee
C) No consequences unless the buyer complains
D) The property is automatically withdrawn from the market
questions.explanation: Failing to disclose can lead to disciplinary or legal action against the licensee.

questions.questionText: What is required when a firm offers compensation to cooperating firms?
options: A) Seller approval
B) Buyer approval
C) A verbal agreement
D) Consent from the REEB
questions.explanation: The seller must authorize compensation agreements in the listing contract.

questions.questionText: What is the primary difference between the WB-28 and WB-29 Cooperative Agreements?
options: A) WB-28 is for residential properties; WB-29 is for commercial properties
B) WB-28 requires earnest money deposits; WB-29 does not
C) WB-28 involves listed properties; WB-29 may involve unlisted properties
D) WB-28 covers rental transactions; WB-29 covers sales only
questions.explanation: The WB-28 is for listed properties, while the WB-29 can involve unlisted commercial properties.

questions.questionText: Under what conditions can a licensee act as a subagent without specific client consent?
options: A) When the subagency benefits the client financially
B) When the principal firm agrees to the subagency
C) When the client’s agency agreement explicitly authorizes it
D) When the client is unavailable for direct consultation
questions.explanation: Subagency must be explicitly authorized in the client’s agency agreement.

questions.questionText: What is a critical risk in verbal negotiations with relocation companies?
options: A) Miscommunication of accepted terms
B) Binding agreements without signatures
C) Delays in contingency fulfillment
D) Disputes over relocation company fees
questions.explanation: Verbal agreements are not binding until properly documented, risking miscommunication.

questions.questionText: When is a licensee required to disclose information suggesting the possibility of a material adverse fact?
options: A) Only when explicitly asked by a party
B) Immediately upon discovery, in writing
C) After consulting with the supervising broker
D) When the seller approves the disclosure
questions.explanation: Disclosure of potential material adverse facts must be timely and in writing.

questions.questionText: How does a buyer agency agreement with an exclusive right to negotiate differ from standard buyer agency agreements?
options: A) It prevents buyers from contacting other firms directly
B) It requires disclosure to the listing firm upon inquiry
C) It gives the buyer’s firm exclusive authority to negotiate on behalf of the buyer
D) It restricts the buyer’s access to open houses without firm consent
questions.explanation: Exclusive right to negotiate grants the buyer’s firm exclusive authority in negotiations.

questions.questionText: What must a listing licensee do when a seller’s condition report contains incorrect information?
options: A) Correct it directly in the report
B) Disclose the information as a potential material adverse fact
C) File a complaint with the Department of Safety and Professional Services (DSPS)
D) Inform the buyer’s licensee but not the buyer
questions.explanation: Incorrect information that suggests a material adverse fact must be disclosed.

questions.questionText: What must a Wisconsin firm include in a cooperative agreement with an out-of-state licensee?
options: A) A shared trust account for earnest money
B) Agreement to use Wisconsin law for dispute resolution
C) Reciprocal licensing terms
D) Exclusivity clauses for the OSL’s future transactions
questions.explanation: Wisconsin law must govern disputes under cooperative agreements.

questions.questionText: How should a licensee handle a material adverse fact disclosed after an offer is accepted?
options: A) Include it as a contingency in the contract
B) Notify all parties immediately in writing
C) Consult with the seller before disclosing
D) Request an inspection to confirm the fact
questions.explanation: Disclosure of material adverse facts must be timely and to all parties.

questions.questionText: What are the risks of ignoring protected buyer provisions in a new listing agreement?
options: A) The seller can cancel the new listing contract
B) The first firm retains commission rights for protected buyers
C) Legal action against the new firm for interference
D) The listing becomes invalid for all buyers
questions.explanation: Protected buyer provisions ensure the first firm’s right to commission for those buyers.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee disclose when selling a property with an underground storage tank?
options: A) The presence and condition of the tank
B) The tank’s registration history
C) The expected cost of removal
D) Nothing unless the tank is leaking
questions.explanation: Licensees must disclose the presence of underground storage tanks.

questions.questionText: Under Wis. Stat. § 452.133(5), what advice can a licensee provide to a customer without an agency agreement?
options: A) General legal advice on the transaction
B) Advice that does not conflict with the interests of another party in the transaction
C) Advice on financing options
D) Advice regarding property valuation
questions.explanation: Licensees may provide advice as long as it does not conflict with the interests of other parties.

questions.questionText: What distinguishes multiple representation with designated agency from other forms of agency relationships under Wis. Stat. § 452.134?
options: A) The firm represents only one client in the transaction
B) The firm assigns different agents to represent each client in the same transaction
C) The firm must remain neutral during negotiations
D) The firm acts as a subagent for another firm
questions.explanation: In designated agency, the firm assigns separate agents to represent each client.

questions.questionText: When drafting an offer to purchase, what must a licensee avoid under Wis. Admin. Code § REEB 24.085?
options: A) Including provisions that conflict with fair housing laws
B) Using language that falsely portrays the buyer’s interest in the property
C) Omitting contingencies requested by the buyer
D) Relying on third-party disclosures
questions.explanation: Licensees must avoid drafting documents that falsely portray any party’s interest.

questions.questionText: How should a licensee proceed if a buyer requests information about a neighboring property’s zoning?
options: A) Refer the buyer to the local zoning authority
B) Consult public records and provide a detailed report
C) Offer a general interpretation of zoning codes
D) Notify the seller of the inquiry
questions.explanation: Licensees should direct buyers to the appropriate zoning authority for accurate information.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee disclose when assisting a buyer with a property subject to a right of first refusal?
options: A) The terms of the right of first refusal
B) A written notice of the right of first refusal to all interested parties
C) The seller’s willingness to negotiate
D) The expected timeline for the refusal
questions.explanation: Licensees must disclose the existence of a right of first refusal in writing.

questions.questionText: What is the primary goal of Wis. Admin. Code § REEB 24.13 regarding the drafting of written proposals?
options: A) To prevent favoritism towards certain buyers
B) To ensure all proposals are presented in a truthful and fair manner
C) To guarantee the use of standardized forms
D) To limit negotiation options for clients
questions.explanation: Written proposals must be fair and truthful to protect all parties involved.

questions.questionText: What legal implication does failing to inspect a property for observable material adverse facts carry?
options: A) Loss of commission
B) Possible license revocation and fines
C) Immediate nullification of the transaction
D) Liability for all repair costs
questions.explanation: Failing to inspect as required can lead to fines and disciplinary action.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of Wis. Admin. Code § REEB 24.13 regarding the drafting of written proposals?
options: A) To prevent favoritism towards certain buyers
B) To ensure all proposals are presented in a truthful and fair manner
C) To guarantee the use of standardized forms
D) To limit negotiation options for clients
questions.explanation: Written proposals must be fair and truthful to protect all parties involved.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee disclose when selling a property with an underground storage tank?
options: A) The presence and condition of the tank
B) The tank’s registration history
C) The expected cost of removal
D) Nothing unless the tank is leaking
questions.explanation: Licensees must disclose the presence of underground storage tanks.

questions.questionText: What must a licensee do when using an unapproved form in a transaction?
options: A) Obtain the client’s verbal approval
B) Ensure the form complies with state statutes
C) Seek guidance from the local real estate board
D) Avoid using the form entirely
questions.explanation: Licensees must ensure unapproved forms comply with Wisconsin law.
